titles: Vindiciæ gratiæ. = A plea for grace More especially the grace of faith. Or, certain lectures as touching the nature and properties of grace and faith: wherein, amongst other matters of great use, the maine sinews of Arminius doctrine are cut asunder. Delivered by that late learned and godly man William Pemble, in Magdalen Hall in Oxford.
author: Pemble, William, 1592?-1623.
Capel, Richard, 1586-1656.
publisher: Printed by R. Young for I. Bartlet, at the golden Cup in Cheape-side,
notes: Running title reads: The nature and properties of grace and faith.
Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
